string.text: To use the binoculars, select them ($$ACTION_wpn_5$$) and press "fire" to zoom in.
To crouch, press ($$ACTION_crouch$$). To crouch even lower, press ($$ACTION_crouch$$) + ($$ACTION_accel$$)
Some stalkers won't want to talk if you stick your weapon in their face. To hide your weapon you only need to select a bolt. ($$ACTION_wpn_6$$).
Jumping will help you climb on top of medium barriers. To jump, press ($$ACTION_jump$$)

You're not a mule, so there's a limit to how much you can carry. When the weight of your gear exceeds your limits, you will start losing energy very quickly. You can monitor the current weight of your equipment and the maximum weight you can carry in your inventory.

When the character wears a radioactive artifact on his belt or enters an area with a high level of background radiation, he starts losing health and exhibits signs of radiation poisoning. Effect of radiation can be countered by using antiradiation drugs and vodka.

By helping other characters you improve their attitude towards you, as well as your general reputation. Better attitude and higher reputation help you when interacting with the people you meet. They will be prone to give you additional information and sell you their items cheaper if you're in their good books. On the other hand, if you open fire at someone, their attitude towards you will quickly turn negative, as will that of their friends, and they will attack you.

Sometimes you will need to run faster than usual. To do this, press ($$ACTION_sprint_toggle$$) while running. A sprinting character runs faster and jumps further, but tires more quickly and is unable to shoot.

If the character does not eat for a while he becomes hungry. Unless he finds something to eat, he will start losing health. To prevent this, the character must eat regularly. A loaf of bread, tinned food or a piece of sausage will solve the problem easily enough, at least for a while.

When stalker gets into a psi-zone or encounters a controller, his psi-state worsens until total loss of the character's consciousness leading to his dying or becoming a zombie. Psi-influence must be stopped as soon as possible for normal mind to be regained.

Sooner or later the character gets so tired that he feels sleepy and sees doubles. To get a good night's sleep, wait out the night, or simply kill some time, find a good place to hit the sack, open the Inventory, activate the sleeping bag and set the amount of time you want to kip down. Your character will wake up at the designated time. Sometimes, he will have dreams.

When your psy-health reaches zero, you will become zombified, if you manage to survive. You practically ignore physical wounds in this condition, but it gets worse - you will become mindless in a couple of days. Sometimes it is equal to death, but you can heal yourself in Yantar lab.

When the character disguises himself in a specific faction's uniform, it lets him remain "under cover". But if he comes too close to an enemy additionally when carrying a weapon, his disguise is surely revealed. Friends may also take him for an enemy if they observe the character from a long distance and the latter is with arms at the ready. If it happened that way, just approach the NPC for him to recognize you. So, it's better to holster your weapon when disguised.

Running for a prolonged period of time causes fatigue. When a character becomes exhausted, he will not be able to run and will move at walking pace. The more the character is carrying, the faster he tires. Standing still for a few seconds is enough to recuperate.

All weapons have a durability parameter. The lower a weapon's durability, the more often it jams. To unjam, reload the weapon by pressing $$ACTION_wpn_reload$$. The weapon's durability decreases with use. A weapon may become completely useless if struck by bullets.

When the character is hit, he may start to bleed. Bleeding causes the character to constantly lose health. The more serious the bleeding (a green icon means slight bleeding, a red icon indicates a serious hemorrhage), the faster the rate at which he loses health. Bleeding will eventually stop with time, but even serious hemorrhages can be stopped immediately using bandages.

In PDA of the deceased stalker, you found his observations after anomalies in tunnels. It turns out to be that he discovered the regularity of their work. You can read this information in your PDA in "Diary" section.
